data.title: The best lunch in Scranton
data.text: By far this is my favorite restaurant in Scranton. The food is always fresh and flavorful and the menu always has something new to try. I have yet to have a bad meal and to top it off, the meals are healthy. Definitely worth a visit, wish they were open for dinner more than once a month!

data.title: My son's recommendations
data.text:
My son brought us here for lunch - one of his go to places for lunch. Tried several dishes - each was really unique and full of flavour. I had a burger and it was the best I recall in some time. We also had a noodle bowl with shrimp- excellent.

Looking for a tasty unique lunch this is it- go early as it fills up, back in Scranton so I'll looking forward to trying other menu items

Gregg

data.title: Quick bite for lunch
data.text: I wanted to try the deli and the kids here.  It has an eclectic menu.  You can have chopped salad, noodle bowls, pastrami on rye, Grilled cheese with soup, or a wrap.  Many options to choose from and price range is between $7.50 to 12 for lunch.  Kids enjoyed and so do we.  Quick service.

data.title: Best lunch place in Scranton
data.text: It can get a little crowded during the peak hours but the menu is on point and the service is always great.

data.title: Great lunch stop
data.text: Had the tortilla soup and a burger, my companion had the brown rice bowl.  Soup was excellent though thicker than you might expect for tortilla soup.  Great flavor, perfect for a raw end-of-December day.  Burger was very good though I wasn't asked how I would like it cooked.  It was a little beyond medium rare.  Rice bowl didn't look as good to me.  Ramen bowl sounds great but haven't tried it yet.  Worth a stop. Will visit again if I ever find myself in Scranton.

data.title: We keep going back!
data.text: I've already reviewed JJ McNally's, but we keep returning.  We were there twice in one week recently, and now make sure any appointments we have in Scranton, which is 50 miles away,  are scheduled around lunch so we can go to JJ's.  Last time my husband and I finished an appointment at 10:00 and walked around Scranton for half an hour waiting for JJ's to open.  My husband had a turkey burger and I had the veggie panini.  We have not been disappointed with anything that we have gotten there.  Coffee is good and the cups are large.

data.title: Great place with good ambiance
data.text: This a place to eat branch. great service by all staff, great food made specifically to your request and the price is more than reasonable.

data.title: Our newest favorite lunch spot!
data.text:
JJ McNally's was recommended to us by a friend.  He raved about their phenomenal breakfast.  Our first attempt to eat at JJ's was for breakfast, but we learned that they didn't open until 10:30.  They had stopped serving breakfast except for a brunch on Saturday.  So, the second time we stopped, we made sure we were there at 10:30.  I had the veggie wrap. It had the usual veggies along with some less usual ones like cauliflower.  The balsamic dressing made it very tasty.  My husband had a porkstrami sandwich with red cabbage.  He raved about it.  One week later we were back again and we live 50 miles away!  This time it was Taco Tuesday.  I had the pork with green salsa and my husband had the chicken burrito.  They were both delicious.  We saw large colorful salads being served, so I asked the waitress what that was.  It was their quinoa salad.  Then we saw their soups go by.  We already can't wait to go back and try some of that!  Presentation was superb and they have really neat desserts, too.  We got two of the individually wrapped soft chocolate chip cookies - the perfect finish for only 35 cents each!

To summarize, I would say that JJ's menu is far from "run of the mill" but is unique with classy presentation, yet it is not reflected in the price.  It is very reasonable.  It also appears that they do a lot of take out orders.  Get there early because they fill up fast.

data.title: Great Breakfast
data.text: We were here for a Saturday morning breakfast (at 10am). You place your order at the counter. We had the steel cut oatmeal and an omelette which were both very good. Friendly staff. Street side parking - which is free on Saturdays.

data.title: Really great salads for the lunch crowd
data.text: McNally's is a great lunch place for soups, salads and really different sandwiches.  So many restaurants offer the same type of food but McNally's really puts a modern, foodie twist on their menu.  It's  clean, the folks are nice and you'll not be disappointed.

data.title: Not Impressed!
data.text: Stopped in for lunch after being inflicted with a jury summons (it's across the street from the courthouse).  Was not at all impressed with the place.  Dark drab interior.  No table service.  After ordering at the counter, was told to wait for the meal.  They couldn't even deliver it to the table.  Yes, food selections were healthy but prices did not appear to be reasonable.  There are better eateries in the downtown area. Look elsewhere.

data.title: Delicious healthy options
data.text: There are many delicious breakfast and lunch options here. The staff is courteous and friendly. I love my salads,sandwiches and bowls from JJ's!

data.title: Wonderful healthy choices
data.text: We stopped in for lunch on Saturday, and had a most pleasant surprise!! So many healthy choices and the food was absolutely delicious. We definitely will come back next time we are in Scranton, this is one of the best in the city!!

data.title: Great lunch menu of healthy mixes
data.text: Great sandwiches at this place but it's strong suit is salads and bowls with interesting mixes of vegetables and cous cous, or quinoa, or barley-- you get the picture.  This place offers great alternatives to the every day, run-of-the-mill lunch faire in a downtown business district. Check it out.  You'll like the menu and you'll like your choice when you get it. And, though the economy is not great, they are one of the few restaurants that is not skimping on the portion size.
